$ZIM gotta love the"this is going to $30" crowd. Share price is reduced in concordance with dividend paid. It's basic financial knowledge. Dividend isn't accretive or compounding. Cash dividends result in cash haircuts to share price.

body: $ZIM You will find a link here to submit a complaint about your broker to the NYSE: https://www.nyse.com/regulation/complaints-and-inquiries

According to the NYSE due-bills only apply to shares that were sold before the ex-div date. They exist so that the dividend may be passed to the new buyer. If your broker uses due-bills as an excuse for not paying you
created_at: they are being dishonest and probably don't want to give the true explanation (which might be that they loaned your shares out and have to wait for a short seller to pony up the dividend.

body: If you write to NYSE
created_at: I suggest you also post a copy to your broker.
